intro: Tinnea somalensis, commonly known as the Somali tinnea, is a flowering plant native to the dry regions of Somalia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, woody shrub form. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming during the dry season. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a rough texture, adapted to the arid environment. Tinnea somalensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and potential ecological significance in its native habitat.
